1.description: Fifteen-year-old wizard attacked by Dementors in Little Whinging. Facing disciplinary action for using magic outside school.

4.description: Brought to Grimmauld Place, headquarters of the Order of the Phoenix. Frustrated by being kept out of important discussions.

11.description: Cleared of charges at his Ministry hearing. Returns to Hogwarts for fifth year under a cloud of skepticism.

13.description: Suffers detention with Umbridge, who forces him to write 'I must not tell lies' with a blood quill.

16.description: Forms Dumbledore's Army to teach Defense Against the Dark Arts. Becomes a teacher to his fellow students.

24.description: Has visions of the Department of Mysteries through his connection to Voldemort. Sees Arthur Weasley being attacked.

26.description: Begins Occlumency lessons with Snape to block his connection to Voldemort.

35.description: Leads DA members to the Ministry to save Sirius, falling into Voldemort's trap.

36.description: Witnesses Sirius's death and duels with Bellatrix. Possessed briefly by Voldemort.

37.description: Learns the full prophecy about him and Voldemort from Dumbledore. Understands his destiny.

8.description: New Defence Against the Dark Arts teacher sent by the Ministry. Gives a speech about progress for progress's sake.

12.description: Refuses to teach practical Defense magic, insisting theory is sufficient. Clashes with Harry about Voldemort's return.

13.description: Uses a blood quill to torture Harry during detention, making him carve words into his own skin.

15.description: Appointed High Inquisitor of Hogwarts with powers to inspect teachers and dismiss them.

28.description: Becomes Headmistress after Dumbledore's departure. Rules with increasingly authoritarian control.

33.description: Discovers Dumbledore's Army and uses Veritaserum to try to extract information from students.

36.description: Forced to admit Voldemort's return when he appears in the Ministry atrium.

4.description: Harry's godfather hosting Order meetings at his ancestral home, Grimmauld Place. Feeling trapped and frustrated.

6.description: Explains the Order of the Phoenix to Harry and reveals the prophecy's existence.

22.description: Appears in the fire at Grimmauld Place to talk with Harry, offering comfort and advice.

35.description: Comes to Harry's rescue at the Department of Mysteries with other Order members.

36.description: Killed by Bellatrix Lestrange, falling through the veil in the Death Chamber.

4.description: Leader of the Order of the Phoenix, fighting against Voldemort. Avoiding Harry to protect him.

11.description: Defends Harry at his Ministry hearing, helping him avoid expulsion from Hogwarts.

27.description: Takes responsibility for Dumbledore's Army and escapes from Ministry officials.

36.description: Arrives at the Ministry and duels Voldemort in the atrium, proving the Dark Lord's return.

37.description: Reveals the full prophecy to Harry and explains why he's been distant all year.

4.description: Member of the Order of the Phoenix, reporting on Death Eater activities. Still unpleasant toward Harry.

24.description: Alerts the Order when Harry has his vision of Arthur Weasley being attacked.

26.description: Begins teaching Harry Occlumency to prevent Voldemort from accessing his mind.

28.description: Harry sees Snape's worst memory in the Pensieve, witnessing James Potter humiliating Snape at school.

4.description: Secret organization fighting against Voldemort, headquartered at Grimmauld Place.

6.description: Reformed after Voldemort's return, with many original members rejoining the fight.

10.description: Dreamy fourth-year Ravenclaw who can see Thestrals. Believes in many strange creatures and conspiracy theories.

16.description: Joins Dumbledore's Army and proves to be a surprisingly capable witch despite her odd beliefs.

35.description: Fights alongside Harry at the Department of Mysteries, showing courage and skill.

16.description: Joins Dumbledore's Army and begins to show real improvement in Defense Against the Dark Arts.

23.description: Reveals his parents were tortured into insanity by Bellatrix Lestrange and other Death Eaters.

35.description: Fights bravely at the Department of Mysteries, showing remarkable courage and growth.

37.description: Could have been the subject of the prophecy instead of Harry, as he was also born at the end of July.

4.description: Fourth-year Gryffindor and youngest Weasley. Growing more confident and outspoken.

16.description: Joins Dumbledore's Army and proves to be a talented witch with particular skill at hexes.

35.description: Fights at the Department of Mysteries, showing she's become a formidable witch.

6.description: Dangerous Death Eater imprisoned in Azkaban for torturing the Longbottoms. Sirius's cousin.

35.description: Escapes from Azkaban and fights at the Department of Mysteries.

36.description: Kills Sirius Black with a curse that sends him through the veil in the Death Chamber.

1.description: Minister for Magic who refuses to believe Voldemort has returned. Campaigns against Harry and Dumbledore.

36.description: Finally sees Voldemort for himself at the Ministry and is forced to admit his return.

3.description: Auror and member of the Order of the Phoenix. Helps escort Harry from Privet Drive.

35.description: Fights at the Department of Mysteries, proving his skill as both an Auror and Order member.

3.description: Former Hogwarts professor and member of the Order of the Phoenix. Still a werewolf, living on the margins.

35.description: Fights at the Department of Mysteries alongside other Order members.

3.description: Real Mad-Eye Moody, paranoid ex-Auror and Order member. Freed after being imprisoned by Barty Crouch Jr.

35.description: Fights at the Department of Mysteries with his usual paranoid vigilance.

4.description: Ministry employee and Order member. Working on guard duty for the Order while maintaining his day job.

23.description: Attacked by Nagini while on guard duty at the Department of Mysteries. Saved by Harry's vision.

24.description: Recovering at St. Mungo's from severe snake bite wounds. Grateful to Harry for saving his life.

4.description: Order member and Weasley family matriarch. Protective of Harry and worried about her family's safety.

5.description: Faces a boggart that transforms into the dead bodies of her family members, revealing her greatest fear.

24.description: Devastated by Arthur's attack but grateful to Harry for his warning vision.

1.description: Unreliable Order member who was supposed to be watching Harry but abandoned his post.

4.description: Small-time criminal and con artist who provides intelligence to the Order despite his unreliability.

16.description: Sixth-year Ravenclaw who joins Dumbledore's Army. Still grieving Cedric Diggory's death.

21.description: Kisses Harry under the mistletoe but their relationship is complicated by her grief and his awkwardness.

28.description: Defends Marietta when she betrays the DA, causing tension with Harry.

14.description: Suggests forming a secret Defense group to learn practical magic. Concerned about Umbridge's inadequate teaching.

16.description: Creates enchanted coins for DA communication and helps organize the group's activities.

27.description: Hexes Marietta Edgecombe when she betrays the DA, causing 'SNEAK' to appear on her face.

35.description: Fights at the Department of Mysteries, using her extensive knowledge to help navigate the battle.

4.description: Fifth-year Gryffindor and Harry's best friend. Living at Grimmauld Place with the Order.

16.description: Joins Dumbledore's Army and works to improve his Defense skills alongside his friends.

19.description: Made a Gryffindor prefect, much to everyone's surprise. Takes his responsibilities seriously.

35.description: Fights bravely at the Department of Mysteries despite being injured by a brain attack.

16.description: Cho Chang's reluctant friend who joins the DA under pressure. Works in the Ministry's Floo Network Office.

27.description: Betrays the DA to Umbridge, resulting in the group's discovery. Hexed by Hermione's jinx.

16.description: Fifth-year Gryffindor who joins Dumbledore's Army. Enthusiastic about learning practical Defense.

11.description: Fifth-year Gryffindor whose mother believes the Daily Prophet's lies about Harry. Initially skeptical of Harry's claims.

16.description: Eventually joins Dumbledore's Army after coming to believe Harry's account of Voldemort's return.
Fifth-year Gryffindor who joins Dumbledore's Army. Eager to learn practical defensive spells.
Fifth-year Gryffindor who joins Dumbledore's Army with her friend Lavender.
Fifth-year Ravenclaw who joins Dumbledore's Army. Twin sister of Parvati.
Fifth-year Ravenclaw who joins Dumbledore's Army. Shows aptitude for defensive magic.
Fifth-year Ravenclaw who joins Dumbledore's Army along with other students from his house.
Sixth-year Ravenclaw who joins Dumbledore's Army. Dating Ginny Weasley.

11.description: Pompous fifth-year Hufflepuff prefect who initially doubts Harry but later supports him.

16.description: Joins Dumbledore's Army after becoming convinced of Harry's truthfulness about Voldemort.
Fifth-year Hufflepuff who joins Dumbledore's Army. Enthusiastic about learning to defend himself.
Fifth-year Hufflepuff who joins Dumbledore's Army. Quiet but determined to learn Defense.

8.description: Fifth-year Hufflepuff whose aunt works for the Ministry. Concerned about the Ministry's denial of Voldemort's return.

16.description: Joins Dumbledore's Army, believing Harry's account of Voldemort's return due to her family connections.
Skeptical Hufflepuff who joins the DA but constantly questions and doubts Harry's teaching methods.

4.description: Seventh-year Gryffindor and one half of the Weasley twins. Developing joke products and planning their business.

16.description: Joins Dumbledore's Army and helps teach younger students defensive magic.

29.description: Leaves Hogwarts in spectacular fashion with George, creating magical mayhem to protest Umbridge's regime.

4.description: Seventh-year Gryffindor and twin to Fred. Co-developing Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes products.

16.description: Member of Dumbledore's Army who helps with training and brings humor to the serious meetings.

29.description: Exits Hogwarts dramatically with Fred, turning the corridor into a swamp and flying away on broomsticks.

16.description: Seventh-year Gryffindor and friend of the Weasley twins who joins Dumbledore's Army.

17.description: Continues his role as Quidditch commentator, becoming increasingly critical of Umbridge's interference.

16.description: Fourth-year Gryffindor who eagerly joins Dumbledore's Army. Enthusiastic about everything Harry teaches.
Second-year Gryffindor who joins Dumbledore's Army despite being very young. Colin's younger brother.
Young student who joins Dumbledore's Army. Eager to learn from Harry despite his youth.

8.description: Head of the Department of Magical Accidents and Catastrophes. Presides over Harry's disciplinary hearing.

4.description: Former Head Boy now working at the Ministry. Has sided with the Ministry against his family over Voldemort's return.

14.description: Writes to Ron warning him away from Harry and suggesting he become a prefect to distance himself.

4.description: Eldest Weasley son working as a curse-breaker for Gringotts. Member of the Order of the Phoenix.

24.description: Visits his father at St. Mungo's after Arthur's attack by Nagini.

4.description: Second eldest Weasley son who works with dragons in Romania. Order member.

3.description: Young Auror and Metamorphmagus who can change her appearance at will. Member of the Order.

35.description: Fights at the Department of Mysteries, using both her Auror training and Order loyalty.

3.description: Elderly wizard and longtime friend of Dumbledore. Member of the Order of the Phoenix.
Member of the Order of the Phoenix who helps escort Harry from Privet Drive.
Member of the Order of the Phoenix involved in guard duty and intelligence work.

14.description: Arrested for attempting to break into the Department of Mysteries while under the Imperius Curse.

3.description: Excitable wizard and Order member who has previously met Harry. Part of the escort guard.
Member of the Order of the Phoenix who participates in Harry's protection detail.

4.description: Ancient house-elf of the Black family who serves at Grimmauld Place. Deeply resentful and muttering constantly.

35.description: Provides information to Narcissa Malfoy about Sirius and Harry, contributing to the trap at the Ministry.

4.description: Screaming portrait of Sirius's mother that cannot be removed from the wall at Grimmauld Place.

8.description: Absent from the start of term feast, having been sent on a mission by Dumbledore.

20.description: Returns from his mission with injuries and bruises, having attempted to recruit the giants.

30.description: Forced to flee Hogwarts when Ministry officials attempt to arrest him and McGonagall is attacked.

12.description: Transfiguration professor and Head of Gryffindor House. Increasingly frustrated with Umbridge's interference.

15.description: Inspected by Umbridge and clearly disapproving of the Ministry's interference in education.

19.description: Strongly supports Harry's career ambitions to become an Auror, opposing Umbridge's discouragement.

30.description: Attacked by multiple Stunners while defending Hagrid, requiring hospitalization at St. Mungo's.

15.description: Herbology professor who is inspected by Umbridge. Continues teaching despite Ministry interference.
Charms professor and Head of Ravenclaw House. Inspected by Umbridge but maintains his teaching standards.
Divination professor who receives a poor inspection from Umbridge and is placed on probation.

26.description: Fired by Umbridge in a humiliating public scene, though Dumbledore allows her to remain at Hogwarts.

37.description: Revealed to be the one who made the prophecy about Harry and Voldemort years ago.

27.description: Centaur recruited by Dumbledore to replace Trelawney as Divination professor after her firing.

13.description: Hogwarts matron who treats students injured by Umbridge's punishments and other incidents.
Hogwarts caretaker who enthusiastically supports Umbridge's harsh punishments and increased authority.

29.description: Unable to remove Fred and George's magical swamp, forced to punt students across it with a pole.

8.description: Filch's cat who prowls the corridors and helps enforce Umbridge's increasingly strict rules.

28.description: Poltergeist who initially obeys Umbridge but later rebels against her authority with increased mischief.

29.description: Takes Fred and George's advice to 'give her hell' and begins an all-out campaign against Umbridge.

12.description: Gryffindor House ghost who provides information about ghostly matters and supports the students.

11.description: Portrait guarding the Gryffindor common room. Witnesses the increased tensions and security concerns.

18.description: Free house-elf working at Hogwarts who helps Harry find the Room of Requirement for DA meetings.

27.description: Warns Harry when Umbridge is approaching the Room of Requirement, helping the DA avoid immediate capture.

18.description: Depressed house-elf working in the Hogwarts kitchens. Still mourning her dismissal from the Crouch family.

23.description: Former Auror and Neville's father, tortured into insanity by Death Eaters. Patient at St. Mungo's.
Former Auror and Neville's mother, tortured into insanity alongside her husband. St. Mungo's patient.

25.description: Gives Neville a Drooble's Best Blowing Gum wrapper, her only way of showing affection.

23.description: Neville's formidable grandmother who visits her son and daughter-in-law at St. Mungo's.

25.description: Former Defense teacher now a patient at St. Mungo's, suffering from permanent memory damage from his own spell.

22.description: Portrait of a former Hogwarts headmistress who can travel between her frames at Hogwarts and St. Mungo's.

25.description: Unspeakable from the Department of Mysteries, patient at St. Mungo's after being cursed while under the Imperius Curse.

35.description: Death Eater and Draco's father who leads the attack at the Department of Mysteries to retrieve the prophecy.

36.description: Fails to retrieve the prophecy and is arrested when Fudge witnesses him at the Ministry.

25.description: Death Eater who escaped from Azkaban. Known for his particularly vicious curses.

35.description: Fights at the Department of Mysteries, using a purple curse that seriously injures Hermione.

25.description: Former Unspeakable turned Death Eater who escaped from Azkaban. Has inside knowledge of the Ministry.

35.description: Uses his knowledge of the Department of Mysteries to help guide the Death Eaters during the battle.

25.description: Death Eater and Bellatrix's husband who escaped from Azkaban with the other Death Eaters.

35.description: Fights alongside his wife and other Death Eaters at the Department of Mysteries.

25.description: Death Eater and Rodolphus's brother who escaped from Azkaban. Participated in torturing the Longbottoms.

35.description: Ministry executioner who is revealed to be a Death Eater during the Department of Mysteries battle.
Death Eater who fights at the Department of Mysteries. Son of another Death Eater of the same name.
Death Eater who participates in the battle at the Department of Mysteries. Father of Theodore Nott.
Death Eater and Vincent Crabbe's father who fights at the Department of Mysteries.
Death Eater and Gregory Goyle's father who participates in the Ministry battle.
Death Eater who fights at the Department of Mysteries. Known for his skill with the Imperius Curse.

17.description: Fifth-year Slytherin and Harry's rival. Appointed to Umbridge's Inquisitorial Squad.

27.description: Uses his Inquisitorial Squad authority to help Umbridge catch Dumbledore's Army members.

36.description: Shocked to learn his father has been arrested as a Death Eater and exposed at the Ministry.

17.description: Fifth-year Slytherin and Draco's friend. Member of Umbridge's Inquisitorial Squad.
Fifth-year Slytherin and Draco's bodyguard. Serves on Umbridge's Inquisitorial Squad.
Fifth-year Slytherin prefect and member of Umbridge's Inquisitorial Squad. Draco's girlfriend.
17.role: Fifth-year student, Inquisitorial Squad member, Prefect

17.description: Fifth-year Slytherin who joins Umbridge's Inquisitorial Squad to gain power over other students.
Slytherin prefect and Quidditch player who becomes a key member of the Inquisitorial Squad.

29.description: Stuck in a Vanishing Cabinet by Fred and George, emerging days later confused and injured.

17.description: Fifth-year Slytherin who joins the Inquisitorial Squad alongside other Slytherin students.
Fifth-year Slytherin and member of the Inquisitorial Squad. Son of Death Eater Nott.
Former Gryffindor Quidditch captain now playing for Puddlemere United. Returns to watch Gryffindor matches.
Seventh-year Gryffindor and Chaser on the Quidditch team. One of the experienced players Harry relies on.
Seventh-year Gryffindor and Chaser on the Quidditch team. Experienced player and team veteran.
Seventh-year Gryffindor who becomes the new Quidditch captain after Oliver Wood graduated.

19.description: Struggles to manage the team while dealing with Umbridge's interference and the twins' banned status.
Student who tries out for Beater position on the Gryffindor Quidditch team to replace the banned twins.
Student who makes the Gryffindor Quidditch team as a Beater replacement, though less skilled than the twins.

17.description: Flying instructor and Quidditch referee who continues to officiate matches despite Ministry interference.

25.description: Former Daily Prophet reporter now forced to write truthful articles for The Quibbler about Harry and Voldemort.

26.description: Writes a tell-all interview with Harry for The Quibbler, revealing the truth about Voldemort's return.
Editor of The Quibbler and Luna's father. Publishes Harry's interview when the Daily Prophet won't print the truth.

27.description: Death Eater who impersonated Mad-Eye Moody the previous year. Mentioned in connection with his father's disgrace.
Former high-ranking Ministry official whose reputation was destroyed by his son's crimes. Now deceased.

30.description: Head of the Department of Magical Games and Sports, mentioned in connection with Ministry affairs.

27.description: Ministry employee and Cedric Diggory's father. Still grieving his son's death and supportive of the truth about Voldemort.

17.description: Group of students, mainly Slytherins, given authority by Umbridge to police other students and enforce her rules.

27.description: Helps Umbridge catch Dumbledore's Army members and enforce increasingly harsh punishments.

recaps.1: Harry and Dudley are attacked by Dementors in Little Whinging. Harry uses magic to save them, causing trouble with the Ministry.
recaps.2: Harry faces punishment from Uncle Vernon and Aunt Petunia, but receives mysterious howlers urging Petunia to keep him safe.
recaps.3: The Order of the Phoenix rescues Harry and takes him to 12 Grimmauld Place, Sirius Black's family home.
recaps.4: Harry learns about the Order and its fight against Voldemort. Tension grows between the adults and Harry's friends.
recaps.5: Harry reunites with Ron and Hermione, but grows frustrated about being left out of important discussions. The house is cleaned of dark objects.
recaps.6: The group heads to the Ministry for Harry's disciplinary hearing. Arthur Weasley escorts him through London.
recaps.7: Harry's hearing takes place. Dumbledore intervenes, and Harry is cleared of charges for using magic in front of Muggles.
recaps.8: The group prepares for the new Hogwarts year, and Harry notices tension about Voldemort's return. The Order warns of danger ahead.
recaps.9: Harry boards the train to Hogwarts and faces stares from skeptical students. He feels isolated by rumors.
recaps.10: Professor Umbridge gives a dull and controlling first lesson as the new Defence Against the Dark Arts teacher. Her refusal to teach practical spells alarms students.
recaps.11: Harry clashes with Umbridge and gets detention, forced to write lines painfully etched into his skin. He struggles with anger and isolation.
recaps.12: Fred and George begin testing joke products on students. Harry has disturbing dreams connected to Voldemort.
recaps.13: Umbridge gains more authority at Hogwarts as 'High Inquisitor.' She evaluates teachers and imposes new rules.
recaps.14: Hermione suggests forming a secret Defence group. Harry reluctantly agrees to teach his classmates.
recaps.15: Dobby helps Harry find a secret room—the Room of Requirement—for their lessons. The group names themselves Dumbledore's Army.
recaps.16: Harry teaches the DA defensive spells in secret. Students grow more confident with each meeting.
recaps.17: Umbridge cracks down further on rule-breaking. Quidditch tensions rise as she bans players.
recaps.18: Harry has a dream of a snake attacking Arthur Weasley. He warns the Order, and Arthur is rescued.
recaps.19: Harry spends Christmas at Grimmauld Place. He fears his connection to Voldemort's mind is dangerous.
recaps.20: Back at Hogwarts, DA meetings continue. Hagrid returns with mysterious injuries from a mission.
recaps.21: Snape begins Occlumency lessons with Harry to block Voldemort's visions. Harry struggles with the difficult practice.
recaps.22: Fred and George escalate pranks as Umbridge's rules tighten. The DA keeps training despite the risk.
recaps.23: Umbridge discovers the DA after a betrayal. Dumbledore takes responsibility and escapes to avoid arrest.
recaps.24: Umbridge becomes Headmistress, increasing her control. Students find creative ways to resist her authority.
recaps.25: Fred and George unleash chaos in Hogwarts and leave school triumphantly. Peeves continues their rebellion.
recaps.26: Harry's visions of the Department of Mysteries grow stronger. He sees Sirius in danger and panics.
recaps.27: Harry, Ron, Hermione, and friends fly to London to rescue Sirius. They infiltrate the Ministry of Magic.
recaps.28: The group finds the Hall of Prophecies and are ambushed by Death Eaters. A battle erupts in the Department of Mysteries.
recaps.29: Members of the Order arrive to help. The fight intensifies, and Sirius is struck and falls through the veil.
recaps.30: Dumbledore duels Voldemort in the Ministry. Harry witnesses the fight and Voldemort's escape.
recaps.31: The truth about the prophecy is revealed to Harry: he and Voldemort are linked by destiny. The year ends in grief and uncertainty.
recaps.32: Harry processes his grief over Sirius's death. The wizarding world finally acknowledges Voldemort's return.
recaps.33: Students prepare to leave Hogwarts for summer. Harry receives unexpected support from classmates who now believe him.
recaps.34: Dumbledore shares more details about the prophecy with Harry. Their relationship begins to heal after the year's tensions.
recaps.35: The DA members reflect on their year of secret training. Many vow to continue practicing over the summer.
recaps.36: Harry packs his belongings, including items inherited from Sirius. He prepares mentally for the war ahead.
recaps.37: Order members escort Harry back to Privet Drive. They warn the Dursleys to treat Harry well.
recaps.38: Harry returns to the Dursleys with new determination. He knows the fight against Voldemort has truly begun.
